title: ICE: Broken MIR in generators

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Polish
labels.description: Async-await issues that are part of the "polish" area

body:
```rust
#![feature(async_await)]

async fn bar() {
}

pub async fn foo() {
    std::thread::spawn(move || ());
    bar().await;
}
```

([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=970fe3fd61ac93849703b5ab3efa8c59)), error:

This is minimized from failing doc-tests in `futures` (https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/futures-rs/issues/1657), from the CI builds there it appears the ICE was introduced between `rustc 1.37.0-nightly (5d8f59f4b 2019-06-04)` and `rustc 1.37.0-nightly (7cdaffd79 2019-06-05)`.
